Enum Class AsymmetricAlgorithm

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<AsymmetricAlgorithm>
com.dua3.utility.crypt.AsymmetricAlgorithm
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<AsymmetricAlgorithm>, Constable
public enum AsymmetricAlgorithm extends Enum<AsymmetricAlgorithm>
Enum representing asymmetric encryption algorithms and their transformations.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class Enum

    Enum.EnumDesc<E>

  • Enum Constant Summary

    Enum Constants
    Enum Constant
    Description
    DSA
    Digital Signature Algorithm (for signatures only)
    EC
    Elliptic Curve Cryptography, requires a special provider for encryption (not signatures and key agreement)
    RSA
    RSA (Rivest-Shamir-Adleman) algorithm with OAEP padding

      RSA (Rivest-Shamir-Adleman) algorithm with OAEP padding

    • EC

    • DSA

    • valueOf

      public static AsymmetricAlgorithm valueOf(String name)
      Returns the enum constant of this class with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this class. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.

    • algorithm

      public String algorithm()
      Retrieves the name of the algorithm represented by this instance.
      Returns:
      the name of the algorithm as a string

    • keyFactoryAlgorithm

      public String keyFactoryAlgorithm()
      Retrieves the algorithm name to use for KeyFactory operations. This may differ from the algorithm name for schemes like ECIES, which use EC keys internally.
      Returns:
      the KeyFactory algorithm name

    • getSignatureAlgorithm

      public Optional<String> getSignatureAlgorithm()
      Retrieves the signature algorithm associated with this asymmetric algorithm, if available.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the signature algorithm as a string, or an empty Optional if no signature algorithm is defined.

    • getTransformation

      public Optional<String> getTransformation()
      Retrieves the transformation string associated with the asymmetric algorithm.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the transformation string, or empty if this algorithm doesn't support direct encryption

    • isEncryptionSupported

      public boolean isEncryptionSupported()
      Checks if this algorithm supports direct asymmetric encryption.
      Returns:
      true if the algorithm supports direct encryption, false otherwise

    • getSupportedKeySizes

      public List<Integer> getSupportedKeySizes()
      Retrieves the supported key sizes for the asymmetric algorithm.
      Returns:
      a list of integers representing the supported key sizes

    • getDefaultKeySize

      public int getDefaultKeySize()
      Retrieves the default key size for the asymmetric algorithm.

      Note: Using lower values is possible, but not recommended.

      Returns:
      the default key size as an integer
